snippet: Companies promoting their offerings for advertisers this week are stressing authentic user-generated videos or professional, trustworthy content.
abstract: Advertising column observes that companies and brands gathered for Advertising Week in New York City are being courted by two groups with differing views on digital content; companies like Google emphasize importance of user-generated video among younger consumers, while blue-chip companies like Walt Disney and Sony continue to rely on professionally-produced content.

byline.original: By STUART ELLIOTT and TANZINA VEGA

lead_paragraph: Companies promoting their offerings for advertisers this week are stressing authentic user-generated videos or professional, trustworthy content.

headline.seo: In Online Video, Street Cred vs. Quality
headline.main: In Online Video, Street Cred vs. Quality
headline.print_headline: In Online Video, Street Cred vs. Quality
